com.myscript.atk.sltw

Interface SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnCursorHandleDragListener

  • Enclosing interface:
    SingleLineTextWidgetApi

    public static interface SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnCursorHandleDragListener
    Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked during a drag sequence of the cursor handle.

    A drag sequence of the cursor handle is initiated when the cursor handle is visible, continues as long as the user drags it around in the writing area and ends when the user releases the handle.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onCursorHandleDrag(int index)
      Called when the cursor handle is being moved during a drag sequence.
      void onCursorHandleDragBegin()
      Called when the user starts dragging the cursor handle.
      void onCursorHandleDragEnd(boolean scrolledAtEnd)
      Called when the user stops dragging the cursor handle.

    • Method Detail

      • onCursorHandleDragBegin

        void onCursorHandleDragBegin()
        Called when the user starts dragging the cursor handle.

      • onCursorHandleDragEnd

        void onCursorHandleDragEnd(boolean scrolledAtEnd)
        Called when the user stops dragging the cursor handle.

        The user may drag the cursor handle and scroll the content at the end of the text. The widget reports that the writing area is scrolled at the end of the text via the scrolledAtEnd boolean value.

        In this case, the application should switch to insertion mode by calling the SingleLineTextWidgetApi.setInsertionMode(int) function. The widget does not change the current working mode automatically.

        Parameters:
        scrolledAtEnd - true if the writing area is scrolled at the end of the text and insertion mode shall be entered, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.setInsertionMode(int)

      • onCursorHandleDrag

        void onCursorHandleDrag(int index)
        Called when the cursor handle is being moved during a drag sequence.

        The cursor is not actually moved by the widget and the cursor index is not actually changed by the widget automatically. The character index corresponds to the current position of the cursor handle.

        You need to call SingleLineTextWidgetApi.setCursorIndex(int) to set the position of the cursor.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index of the cursor.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.setCursorIndex(int)
